warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand next to a wall or support for balance.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Swing one leg forward and backward in a controlled manner. Perform 2 sets of 10 swings per leg.
Perform squats with a focus on depth and control. Perform 2 sets of 10 reps.
Rotate your hips in a circular motion, first clockwise, then counterclockwise. Perform 1 set of 10 circles each direction.

exercises.setup: Position the barbell on your upper traps. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
execution: 1. Stand under the barbell and position it on your upper traps.
2. Grip the bar with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
3. Unrack the bar and step back, setting your feet shoulder-width apart.
4. Keep your chest up and core engaged.
5. Squat down by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight.
6. Lower until your thighs are parallel to the ground or slightly below.
7. Push through your heels to return to the starting position.
8. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on maintaining a stable posture and a proper bar path throughout the movement.

exercises.setup: Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench and a barbell over your hips.
execution: 1. Sit on the ground with your upper back against a bench.
2. Roll the barbell over your hips.
3. Plant your feet flat on the ground, shoulder-width apart.
4. Drive through your heels to lift your hips until they are fully extended.
5. Keep a neutral pelvis and squeeze your glutes at the top.
6. Lower your hips back to the starting position.
7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercises: American Hip Thrust, Banded Hip Thrust
exercises.additional_tips: Ensure a neutral pelvic position for optimal glute activation.

exercises.setup: Start with the bar on the ground. Pick it up like a regular deadlift for the first rep.
execution: 1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the barbell with an overhand grip.
2. Keep your chest up and shoulders back.
3. Push your hips back while keeping your knees slightly bent.
4. Lower the barbell along your legs until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
5. Keep the bar close to your body and maintain a flat back.
6. Return to the starting position by driving your hips forward.
7. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain proper form to avoid lower back strain.

exercises.setup: Position one foot on a bench behind you.
execution: 1. Stand a few feet in front of a bench.
2. Place one foot on the bench behind you.
3. Keep your torso upright and core engaged.
4. Lower your body by bending the front knee.
5. Descend until your front thigh is parallel to the ground.
6. Push through the front heel to return to the starting position.
7. Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching legs.
exercises.weight: Use bodyweight or light dumbbells to maintain balance and control.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on balance and control to maximize the stretch on the quads.

exercises.exercise_name: Smith Machine Front Foot Elevated Lunge
exercises.setup: Position the front foot on an elevated platform. The back foot should be placed comfortably far back, standing on the toe for balance.
execution: 1. Stand in the Smith Machine with the bar resting on your shoulders.
2. Place your front foot on an elevated platform.
3. Keep your back foot on the ground, standing on the toe.
4. Lower your body by bending the front knee, keeping most of the weight on the front foot.
5. Descend slowly and pause at the bottom.
6. Push through the front heel to return to the starting position.
7. Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching legs.
exercises.weight: Use bodyweight or light dumbbells to maintain balance and control.
exercises.additional_tips: Ensure to rest between switching legs to avoid systemic fatigue.
